numlitem.para: Associated ENGINE BLEED switch is selected OFF except for engine start,
Aircraft is not operated in known or forecast icing conditions,
L and R ISLN valves are open for takeoff, and when flaps are operated,
Bleed systems on remaining engines are operative,
Associated Engine Anti-Ice switch remains OFF, and
For the associated engine, select Engine Bleed OFF except for ground engine start and when bleed air is required for inflight start.
APU-TO-PACK TAKEOFF procedure is not permitted since L and R ISLN Valves must remain open during takeoff.

During takeoff and for all flap operations, ensure that the L and R ISLN valve switches are in the open position. This assures air is available for operation of the air-driven hydraulic demand pump and LE flaps in the event of an adjacent engine shutdown.
Do not select associated engine Nacelle Anti-Ice Switch ON. If icing conditions are inadvertently encountered, reducing thrust on affected engine will minimize possible damage if ice is ingested.
Operations into known or forecast icing conditions is prohibited.
Reduce performance limited takeoff and landing weight by 4,500 lbs.
Reduce performance limited en route weight by 6,300 lbs.
APU-TO-PACK TAKEOFF procedure is not permitted.

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "ENG_PRECOOLER INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.
